message.content:
Sure, I can help you with that! Here's a healthy meal plan for seven days that excludes the foods you mentioned:

Day 1: Breakfast - Overnight oats with fruit and nuts; Lunch - Grilled chicken salad with mixed greens, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, and balsamic vinaigrette; Dinner - Baked salmon with roasted vegetables and quinoa

Day 2: Breakfast - Avocado toast with scrambled eggs and cherry tomatoes; Lunch - Turkey and cheese wrap with mixed greens and hummus; Dinner - Slow cooker lentil soup with kale and quinoa

Day 3: Breakfast - Smoothie bowl with frozen berries, banana, spinach, and almond milk topped with nuts and seeds; Lunch - Grilled chicken breast with mixed greens and a balsamic vinaigrette dressing; Dinner - Stir-fry with tofu, mixed vegetables, and brown rice

Day 4: Breakfast - Oatmeal with sliced banana, honey, and walnuts; Lunch - Tuna salad sandwich with mixed greens and whole wheat bread; Dinner - Grilled shrimp with roasted sweet potatoes and green beans

Day 5: Breakfast - Scrambled eggs with spinach, mushrooms, and whole wheat toast; Lunch - Chicken Caesar salad with romaine lettuce, cherry tomatoes, and a homemade Caesar dressing; Dinner - Baked chicken breast with roasted broccoli and quinoa

Day 6: Breakfast - Greek yogurt with mixed berries and granola; Lunch - Grilled chicken wrap with mixed greens and hummus; Dinner - Slow cooker beef stew with carrots, potatoes, and quinoa

Day 7: Breakfast - Smoothie with frozen berries, banana, spinach, and almond milk topped with nuts and seeds; Lunch - Turkey and cheese sandwich on whole wheat bread with mixed greens; Dinner - Grilled salmon with roasted asparagus and quinoa

Remember, this is just a sample meal plan and you may need to adjust the portion sizes based on your individual calorie needs. Also, feel free to swap out any of the ingredients with similar alternatives that fit your dietary restrictions.
